head.title: Mexican Murder Suspect Is Sought by U.S.

hedline.hl1: Mexican Murder Suspect Is Sought by U.S.

abstract.p: US seeks extradition from Mexico of Agustin Vasquez Mendoza, who is suspected of the 1994 murder of Richard Fass, an American anti-drug agent (S)

block.p: The United States is seeking the extradition from Mexico of a man suspected of killing an American anti-drug agent in Arizona in 1994, officials said today.

Agustin Vasquez Mendoza, who was placed on the F.B.I.'s 10 Most-Wanted list four years ago, was arrested in Puebla, Mexico, on Sunday by Mexican federal police working with American law enforcement authorities, the officials said.
The United States is seeking the extradition from Mexico of a man suspected of killing an American anti-drug agent in Arizona in 1994, officials said today.

Agustin Vasquez Mendoza, who was placed on the F.B.I.'s 10 Most-Wanted list four years ago, was arrested in Puebla, Mexico, on Sunday by Mexican federal police working with American law enforcement authorities, the officials said.

Mr. Vasquez, 30, is being sought for the murder of Richard Fass, a special agent of the United States Drug Enforcement Administration. Mr. Vasquez and several associates are accused of killing Mr. Fass, who was working undercover as a potential buyer of 22 pounds of methamphetamine.
Donnie R. Marshall, the D.E.A. administrator, said a ring led by Mr. Vasquez specialized in the robbery of drug dealers and took part in murders, kidnappings and other crimes.

''His apprehension proves to drug traffickers around that world that no one who harms or kills a D.E.A. agent, law enforcement officer or other public official will be allowed to remain free,'' Mr. Marshall said.
